## Description {#details}

Provides analysis for continuously CSEing during GISel passes.

<Link id="l00061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="61"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This installs itself as a delegate to the MachineFunction to track</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="62"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// new instructions as well as deletions. It however will not be able to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="63"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// track instruction mutations. In such cases, recordNewInstruction should be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="64"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// called (for eg inside MachineIRBuilder::recordInsertion).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="65"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Also because of how just the instruction can be inserted without adding any</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="66"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// operands to the instruction, instructions are uniqued and inserted lazily.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="67"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// CSEInfo should assert when trying to enter an incomplete instruction into</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="68"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// the CSEMap. There is Opcode level granularity on which instructions can be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="69"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// CSE&#39;d and for now, only Generic instructions are CSEable.</span></CodeLine>
